metadata.notes: Structured from provided TCM meridian pathway descriptions.

meridians.name: Lung
meridians.start: Internal middle jiao; connects to Large Intestine and emerges on the chest near LU-1 under the clavicle
course: Originates internally in the middle jiao and connects to the Large Intestine
Ascends to the lungs and throat
Emerges near LU-1 on the chest and travels down the antero-lateral shoulder and arm along the radial side
Passes the wrist (radial artery area) and the thenar eminence
branches: Branch at LU-7 connects to the Large Intestine meridian on the index finger

meridians.name: Large Intestine
meridians.start: Radial side of the index finger (LI-1)
meridians.end: Side of the nose (LI-20), meeting the Stomach meridian
course: Runs up the lateral aspect of the arm past the elbow and shoulder to LI-15
Crosses over the shoulder to the supraclavicular area
Internal branch connects to the lung and descends to the Large Intestine organ
External path ascends the neck and cheek, circles around the lower lip, and ends at LI-20
branches: Internal branch links lung to Large Intestine organ

meridians.name: Stomach
meridians.start: Beside the nose at the ala nasi near LI-20
meridians.end: Lateral side of the second toe (ST-45)
course: Ascends to the bridge of the nose and inner corner of the eye
Descends lateral to the nose and around the mouth to the chin
Runs down the front of the neck and chest
Continues through the abdomen about 2 cun lateral to the midline and passes the inguinal region
Travels along the front of the thigh and down the antero-lateral lower leg over the dorsum of the foot
connections: Originates near the Large Intestine meridian at LI-20

meridians.name: Spleen
meridians.start: Medial side of the big toe (SP-1)
meridians.end: Lateral chest around the 2nd intercostal space on the mid-axillary line (SP-21)
course: Runs along the medial edge of the foot and ascends in front of the medial malleolus
Continues up the inner lower leg and inner thigh
Enters the groin and lower abdomen then runs upward 4 cun lateral to the abdominal midline toward the chest
Spreads to the lower chest and reaches the area near SP-21
branches: Internal connections to the Spleen and Stomach organs with a branch linking to the Heart

meridians.name: Heart
meridians.start: Heart organ, descending internally to connect with the Small Intestine
meridians.end: Radial corner of the little fingernail (HT-9)
course: Emerges from the axilla at HT-1
Travels down the posterior-medial arm along the inner biceps and ulnar forearm
Passes the wrist at HT-7 and runs to the palm’s ulnar side
branches: Branch from the Heart links to the Small Intestine meridian at the little finger

meridians.name: Small Intestine
meridians.start: Ulnar side of the little finger (SI-1)
meridians.end: Front of the ear at SI-19
course: Runs up the posterior side of the hand and arm
Travels along the lateral-posterior shoulder to the scapula region near SI-11
Zigzags upward to the upper back (near SI-14 and SI-15) and the supraclavicular fossa
Branch ascends the neck and cheek to the outer canthus, then enters the ear to SI-19
branches: Internal pathway connects to the Heart and Stomach organs
Branch to the ear links with the Gall Bladder channel around GB-1

meridians.name: Bladder
meridians.end: Lateral side of the small toe (BL-67)
course: Ascends over the forehead and crown
From the vertex enters the brain briefly then bifurcates into two parallel branches down the back of the head and neck
Runs down the back with one branch near the spine and another about 1.5 cun lateral, continuing through the lumbar region and buttocks
Branches reunite in the gluteal region and proceed down the posterior thigh and calf
Passes behind the lateral malleolus to the small toe

meridians.name: Kidney
meridians.start: Sole under the little toe (KI-1, Yongquan)
course: Crosses the foot arch and emerges behind the inner ankle near KI-3
Ascends the medial leg through the calf and inner knee then up the inner thigh
Enters the spine near the kidney area and connects internally with the Kidneys and Bladder
Ascends through the abdomen 0.5 cun lateral to the Ren channel and passes through the chest to KI-27
branches: Internal branch rises to the throat and root of the tongue

meridians.name: Pericardium
course: Originates in the chest and descends through the diaphragm connecting with the upper, middle, and lower jiao
Emerges on the lateral chest near PC-1 (4th intercostal space)
Runs along the inner arm between the Lung and Heart channels down the center of the anterior forearm
Passes the wrist at PC-7 through the carpal tunnel into the palm
branches: Branch from the palm connects to the San Jiao meridian at the ring finger

meridians.name: San Jiao (Triple Burner)
meridians.start: Ulnar side of the ring finger (SJ-1)
course: Runs up the back of the hand and posterior arm, passing the elbow near SJ-10 and along the shoulder
Reaches the supraclavicular fossa near ST-12
External branch ascends the neck, goes around the ear, and circles to the temple before ending at SJ-23
branches: Internal branch descends through the upper, middle, and lower jiao connecting to the pericardium and three divisions of the torso

meridians.name: Gallbladder
course: Ascends to the corner of the forehead
Winds down behind the ear passing GB-12 and zigzags across the side of the head through points like GB-14
Travels down the side of the neck to the top of the shoulder (GB-21) and along the lateral ribcage
Continues down the side of the torso and lateral hip, encircling the gluteal region
Runs down the lateral thigh and leg, past the knee and fibula to the anterior lateral malleolus

meridians.name: Liver
meridians.start: Lateral side of the big toe (LV-1)
meridians.end: Costal region below the breasts at LV-14
course: Runs along the top of the foot to the ankle and ascends in front of the medial malleolus
Travels up the medial lower leg and knee, then along the inner thigh to the pubic region
Encircles the external genitalia and ascends the lower abdomen connecting internally with the Liver and Gallbladder organs
Continues upward along the abdomen and chest to LV-14 in the 6th intercostal space
branches: Internal branch rises through the diaphragm, along the throat to the nasopharynx, connecting to the eyes and the vertex

meridians.name: Conception Vessel
meridians.start: Lower abdomen/uterus; emerges at the perineum (Ren-1)
meridians.end: Depression between the lower lip and chin (Ren-24)
course: Ascends the anterior midline from the perineum through the pubic area (Ren-2)
Continues up the belly passing Ren-6 and Ren-8 at the navel
Travels through the chest at Ren-17 on the sternum to the throat and chin

meridians.name: Governing Vessel
meridians.start: Lower abdomen; emerges at the perineum near the tailbone (Du-1)
meridians.end: Upper gum inside the mouth at Du-28
course: Ascends the midline of the spine through the lumbar and thoracic vertebrae (including Du-4 at L2 and Du-14 at C7)
Continues up the neck and over the head along the midline to Du-20 at the crown
Descends down the forehead to end at the upper gum inside the mouth
